birth_place.zh-cn: 大清北京紫禁城撷芳殿
birth_place.en: Xiefang Hall, Forbidden City, Beijing, Great Qing

death_place.en: Jiuzhou Qingyan Hall, Old Summer Palace

description.zh-cn: 清朝第八位皇帝（1820年-1850年在位），清仁宗嘉庆帝的次子，生母为孝淑睿皇后。他是清朝历史上仅有的两位以嫡长子身份继承皇位的皇帝之一。在位期间，中国与英国爆发了第一次鸦片战争，并签订了中国近代史上第一个不平等条约《南京条约》。
description.en: The eighth emperor of the Qing dynasty, reigning from 1820 to 1850. He was the second son of the Jiaqing Emperor and Empress Xiaoshurui. He was one of only two Qing emperors to inherit the throne as the eldest legitimate son. During his reign, the First Opium War broke out between China and Great Britain, concluding with the signing of the Treaty of Nanking, the first of the unequal treaties.

description.zh-cn: 清朝第七位皇帝，乾隆帝第十五子，道光帝的父亲。
description.en: The seventh emperor of the Qing dynasty, the fifteenth son of the Qianlong Emperor, and the father of the Daoguang Emperor.

description.zh-cn: 嘉庆帝的皇后，道光帝的生母。
description.en: Empress of the Jiaqing Emperor and the birth mother of the Daoguang Emperor.

description.zh-cn: 清朝第九位皇帝，道光帝的第四子和继承人。
description.en: The ninth emperor of the Qing dynasty, the fourth son and successor of the Daoguang Emperor.

description.zh-cn: 道光帝的皇后，咸丰帝的生母。
description.en: Empress of the Daoguang Emperor and the birth mother of the Xianfeng Emperor.

description.zh-cn: 嘉庆十八年由天理教发动的一次起事，部分教徒攻入紫禁城，被时为皇子的绵宁（道光帝）用鸟铳击退。
description.en: An uprising launched by the Tianli Cult in 1813, during which some followers broke into the Forbidden City and were repelled by Mianning (the future Daoguang Emperor), who was then a prince.

description.zh-cn: 清朝中期的民间宗教组织，于嘉庆十八年发动癸酉之变。
description.en: A folk religious organization in the mid-Qing dynasty that launched the Guiyou Uprising in 1813.

description.zh-cn: 19世纪中期英国为打开中国市场而发动的侵华战争，以清朝失败并签订《南京条约》告终。
description.en: A war of aggression launched by Great Britain against China in the mid-19th century to open up Chinese markets, which ended in the defeat of the Qing dynasty and the signing of the Treaty of Nanking.

description.zh-cn: 中国最后一个帝制王朝，由满族建立。
description.en: The last imperial dynasty of China, established by the Manchu people.

description.zh-cn: 19世纪的海上强国，为扩大贸易发动了第一次鸦片战争。
description.en: A maritime power in the 19th century that launched the First Opium War to expand its trade.

description.zh-cn: 清朝在第一次鸦片战争战败后与英国签订的中国近代史上第一个不平等条约。
description.en: The first of the unequal treaties in modern Chinese history, signed between the Qing dynasty and Great Britain after China's defeat in the First Opium War.

description.zh-cn: 根据《南京条约》，清朝割让给英国的岛屿。
description.en: An island ceded by the Qing dynasty to Great Britain under the Treaty of Nanking.

description.zh-cn: 清朝政治家，被道光帝任命为钦差大臣赴广东查禁鸦片，主导了虎门销烟。
description.en: A Qing dynasty statesman appointed by the Daoguang Emperor as Imperial Commissioner to Canton to eradicate opium, where he led the destruction of opium at Humen.

description.zh-cn: 林则徐在广东虎门集中销毁鸦片的历史事件，是第一次鸦片战争的导火索。
description.en: A historical event where Lin Zexu centrally destroyed opium at Humen, Guangdong, which served as a direct cause of the First Opium War.

description.zh-cn: 清朝大臣，在林则徐被革职后与英方代表谈判，后因单方面公布《穿鼻草约》被道光帝革职。
description.en: A Qing dynasty official who negotiated with the British representative after Lin Zexu's dismissal. He was later dismissed by the Daoguang Emperor for unilaterally announcing the Convention of Chuanbi.

description.zh-cn: 第一次鸦片战争期间，清朝钦差大臣琦善与英国代表义律私拟的和约草案，未被双方政府承认。
description.en: A draft peace agreement privately negotiated by Qing Imperial Commissioner Qishan and British representative Charles Elliot during the First Opium War, which was not recognized by either government.

description.zh-cn: 清朝第六位皇帝，嘉庆帝的父亲，道光帝的祖父。
description.en: The sixth emperor of the Qing dynasty, father of the Jiaqing Emperor and grandfather of the Daoguang Emperor.

description.zh-cn: 道光帝的第一任嫡福晋，在其登基前去世，后被追封为皇后。
description.en: The first primary consort of the Daoguang Emperor, who passed away before his ascension to the throne and was posthumously honored as an empress.

description.zh-cn: 道光帝的第二任继福晋，道光帝登基后被立为皇后。
description.en: The second primary consort of the Daoguang Emperor, who was installed as empress after his enthronement.

description.zh-cn: 道光帝的皇贵妃，恭忠亲王奕䜣的生母，咸丰帝即位后尊为皇考康慈皇贵太妃，病笃时尊为康慈皇太后。
description.en: An Imperial Noble Consort of the Daoguang Emperor, birth mother of Prince Gong (Yixin). After the Xianfeng Emperor's accession, she was honored as Imperial Noble Consort Kangci, and later as Empress Dowager Kangci when she fell critically ill.

description.zh-cn: 道光帝的第六子，晚清重要的政治家、军事家和外交家。
description.en: The sixth son of the Daoguang Emperor, an important statesman, military leader, and diplomat in the late Qing dynasty.

description.zh-cn: 指清朝嘉庆、道光两朝国势由盛转衰的时期。历史学家孟森认为宣宗的庸暗是此现象的原因之一。
description.en: Refers to the period of decline in the Qing dynasty during the reigns of the Jiaqing and Daoguang emperors. Historian Meng Sen considered the mediocrity and shortsightedness of Emperor Xuanzong (Daoguang) to be a contributing factor.

description.zh-cn: 紫禁城内的一座宫殿，是道光帝的出生地。
description.en: A palace within the Forbidden City, the birthplace of the Daoguang Emperor.

description.zh-cn: 道光帝是嘉庆帝的次子。
description.en: The Daoguang Emperor was the second son of the Jiaqing Emperor.

description.zh-cn: 道光帝的生母是孝淑睿皇后喜塔腊氏。
description.en: The Daoguang Emperor's birth mother was Empress Xiaoshurui of the Hitara clan.

description.zh-cn: 孝淑睿皇后是嘉庆帝的皇后。
description.en: Empress Xiaoshurui was the empress of the Jiaqing Emperor.

description.zh-cn: 咸丰帝是道光帝的第四子。
description.en: The Xianfeng Emperor was the fourth son of the Daoguang Emperor.

description.zh-cn: 咸丰帝的生母是孝全成皇后。
description.en: The Xianfeng Emperor's birth mother was Empress Xiaoquancheng.

description.zh-cn: 孝全成皇后于道光十四年被立为皇后。
description.en: Empress Xiaoquancheng was installed as empress in the 14th year of the Daoguang era.

description.zh-cn: 孝穆成皇后是道光帝为皇子时的嫡福晋。
description.en: Empress Xiaomucheng was the primary consort of the Daoguang Emperor when he was a prince.

description.zh-cn: 孝慎成皇后在道光帝登基后被立为皇后。
description.en: Empress Xiaoshencheng was installed as empress after the Daoguang Emperor ascended the throne.

description.zh-cn: 孝静成皇后是道光帝的皇贵妃。
description.en: Empress Xiaojingcheng was an Imperial Noble Consort of the Daoguang Emperor.

description.zh-cn: 奕䜣是道光帝的第六子。
description.en: Yixin was the sixth son of the Daoguang Emperor.

description.zh-cn: 奕䜣的生母是孝静成皇后。
description.en: Yixin's birth mother was Empress Xiaojingcheng.

description.zh-cn: 嘉庆四年，嘉庆帝依照秘密建储制，立时为绵宁的道光帝为太子。
description.en: In the fourth year of the Jiaqing era, the Jiaqing Emperor, following the system of secret succession, designated Mianning (the future Daoguang Emperor) as Crown Prince.

description.zh-cn: 道光帝在驾崩当日降下朱笔谕旨，立皇四子奕𬣞（咸丰帝）为皇太子，继承大统。
description.en: On the day of his death, the Daoguang Emperor issued an imperial edict in his own hand, establishing his fourth son Yizhu (the Xianfeng Emperor) as Crown Prince to succeed to the throne.

description.zh-cn: 天理教于嘉庆十八年发动了癸酉之变。
description.en: The Tianli Cult launched the Guiyou Uprising in the 18th year of the Jiaqing era.

description.zh-cn: 因在癸酉之变中，以鸟铳击毙两名乱匪的英勇表现，尚为皇子的绵宁被嘉庆帝封为“智亲王”。
description.en: Due to his heroic performance in the Guiyou Uprising, where he shot and killed two rebels with a musket, Prince Mianning was enfeoffed as 'Prince Zhi' by the Jiaqing Emperor.

description.zh-cn: 在癸酉之变中，尚为皇子的绵宁（道光帝）用鸟铳击毙两名攻入紫禁城的天理教徒。
description.en: During the Guiyou Uprising, Prince Mianning (the future Daoguang Emperor) shot and killed two Tianli Cult members who had stormed the Forbidden City.

description.zh-cn: 道光十八年十一月，道光帝任命林则徐为钦差大臣，赴广东查禁鸦片。
description.en: In the eleventh month of the 18th year of the Daoguang era, the Daoguang Emperor appointed Lin Zexu as Imperial Commissioner to go to Guangdong to ban opium.

description.zh-cn: 林则徐作为钦差大臣，主导了虎门销烟。
description.en: As the Imperial Commissioner, Lin Zexu led the destruction of opium at Humen.

description.zh-cn: 虎门销烟成为第一次鸦片战争的直接导火索。
description.en: The destruction of opium at Humen became the direct trigger for the First Opium War.

description.zh-cn: 英国为报复虎门销烟和打开中国市场，发动了第一次鸦片战争。
description.en: Great Britain launched the First Opium War in retaliation for the destruction of opium at Humen and to open Chinese markets.

description.zh-cn: 清朝在第一次鸦片战争中战败，被迫签订《南京条约》。
description.en: The Qing dynasty was defeated in the First Opium War and was forced to sign the Treaty of Nanking.

description.zh-cn: 道光二十年九月，因英军北上，道光帝将林则徐革职。
description.en: In the ninth month of the 20th year of the Daoguang era, the Daoguang Emperor dismissed Lin Zexu due to the British fleet's advance north.

description.zh-cn: 第一次鸦片战争的结束标志是中英双方签订《南京条约》。
description.en: The end of the First Opium War was marked by the signing of the Treaty of Nanking between China and Great Britain.

description.zh-cn: 《南京条约》迫使清朝割让香港岛、开放五个通商口岸并赔款，严重损害了其主权。
description.en: The Treaty of Nanking forced the Qing dynasty to cede Hong Kong Island, open five treaty ports, and pay indemnities, severely damaging its sovereignty.

description.zh-cn: 根据《南京条约》的规定，香港岛被割让给英国。
description.en: According to the provisions of the Treaty of Nanking, Hong Kong Island was ceded to Great Britain.

description.zh-cn: 道光帝不承认琦善与义律私拟的《穿鼻草约》。
description.en: The Daoguang Emperor refused to recognize the Convention of Chuanbi privately negotiated by Qishan and Charles Elliot.

description.zh-cn: 因英军占领香港岛及签订《穿鼻草约》事宜，道光帝于道光二十一年二月将琦善革职查办。
description.en: Due to the British occupation of Hong Kong Island and the signing of the Convention of Chuanbi, the Daoguang Emperor dismissed and investigated Qishan in the second month of the 21st year of the Daoguang era.

description.zh-cn: 历史学家孟森认为道光帝的庸暗是清朝入关以来所未有，其统治时期被视为“嘉道中衰”的一部分。
description.en: Historian Meng Sen considered the mediocrity and shortsightedness of the Daoguang Emperor to be unprecedented since the Qing entered the Shanhai Pass, and his reign is considered part of the 'Jiaqing-Daoguang decline'.

description.zh-cn: 道光帝出生于紫禁城内的撷芳殿。
description.en: The Daoguang Emperor was born in Xiefang Hall within the Forbidden City.

description.zh-cn: 道光帝于1820年至1850年担任清朝皇帝。
description.en: The Daoguang Emperor served as the Emperor of the Qing dynasty from 1820 to 1850.

description.zh-cn: 道光帝是乾隆帝的孙子。
description.en: The Daoguang Emperor was the grandson of the Qianlong Emperor.
